Header: Police Media Spokesman elaborates on the manner the voters should behave on Election Day
Content: Police Media Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunasekara has elaborated on the manner the voters should behave on the Election Day. The Police Media Spokesman said that based on the provisions in the Presidential Election Act certain activities are barred within a radius of 500 metres of the election booth, the day on which the election is being held. As an example he cited that propaganda activities have been banned. If already there is an election office legally established within this 500 metres, it is permitted to maintain any cutouts or banners legally established according to the guidelines. Other than that mass gatherings are barred in attrition to engaging in propaganda.
